head.title: 3 Men Are Fatally Shot Within 8 Hours

hedline.hl1: 3 Men Are Fatally Shot Within 8 Hours

abstract.p: Three young men are fatally shot in unrelated homicides in New York City: Carl Briggs in Kensington, Brooklyn, and unidentified men in University Heights and Harlem (S)

block.p: Three young men were fatally shot yesterday in unrelated homicides in New York, the police said.
In the first killing, at 2:30 p.m., Carl Briggs, 24, was shot once in the head outside 558 Parkside Avenue in Kensington, Brooklyn.
Three young men were fatally shot yesterday in unrelated homicides in New York, the police said.
In the first killing, at 2:30 p.m., Carl Briggs, 24, was shot once in the head outside 558 Parkside Avenue in Kensington, Brooklyn.
Mr. Briggs was declared dead on arrival at Kings County Hospital Center, said Detective John Giammarino, a police spokesman.
At 9:50 p.m., a 24-year-old man was fatally shot once in the chest outside 52 West 182nd Street in University Heights, the Bronx.
The third killing was at 10:36 p.m., when a 28-year-old man was shot twice in the chest and once in the groin, Detective Giammarino said.
The victim, who was found outside 2176 Fifth Avenue in Harlem, was pronounced dead on arrival at Harlem Hospital Center.
In all three cases, the weapons have not been found and the assailants are thought to be men. The motives behind the killings are unknown.
The police did not release the names of two of the three victims because their families had not been notified.
